required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Early Onset of Antipsychotic Drug Action in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Predicting Response to Risperidone Treatment Through Identification of Early-onset of Antipsychotic Drug Action in Schizophrenia.

brief_summary.textblock: The current study has been designed to address the significance of early onset of response prospectively in patients treated with an atypical antipsychotic.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes From Study Period II Baseline (Week 0) to Weeks 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score in Early Onset Response and Not Early Onset Response-Risperidone Patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Study Period III Baseline (Week 2) to Weeks 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Total Score in Not Early Onset Response-Risperidone and Not Early Onset Response-Olanzapine Patients
The Number of Participants in the Early Onset (EO) and Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score

The Number of Participants in the Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) and Not Early Onset-Olanzapine (NEO-OLZ) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score

Number of Participants in the Early Onset and Not Early Onset-Risperidone Groups Who Show a 50% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score From Baseline or Meet 'a Priori' Specified Criteria for Remission

Number of Participants in the Not Early Onset-Risperidone and Not Early Onset-Olanzapine Groups Who Show a 50% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Total Score From Baseline or Meet 'a Priori' Specified Criteria for Remission
Number of Participants With Psychiatric Hospitalizations in the Early Onset and Not Early Onset-Risperidone Groups
Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Body Mass Index
Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Abnormal Fasting Laboratory Analytes Reported in >=2% of All Participants
Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Modified Simpson-Angus Scale
Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale - Total Score
Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)- Non-Global Total Score
Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Sitting Pulse Rate
Vital Signs - Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Standing Diastolic Blood Pressure
Vital Signs - Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Standing Mean Arterial Pressure
Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Standing Pulse Rate
Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Standing Systolic Blood Pressure
Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Body Weight

arm_group.description: Olanzapine for Not Early Onset response (NEO) patients
Risperidone for Not Early Onset response (NEO) patients
Risperidone for Early Onset response (EO) patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must demonstrate acute psychopathologic severity criteria and be at least moderately ill.
- Patients must have experienced an exacerbation of their illness within the previous 2 weeks.
- Patients in whom a switch to another antipsychotic medication is acutely indicated.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are deemed nonresponsive to risperidone or olanzapine.
- Patients who have been hospitalized for greater than 2 weeks immediately prior to Visit 1.
- Patients having received olanzapine or risperidone in the past 30 days.
- Treatment with clozapine within 1 year prior to Visit 1.
- Diagnosis of substance-induced psychosis by Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) criteria within 7 days of Visit 1 (or at any time during the study), or confirmed on clinical grounds within 72 hours subsequent to Visit 1 (or at any time during the study).
- A diagnosis of Parkinson's disease, dementia-related psychosis, or related disorders.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study Period I was the screening period prior to enrollment. Study Period II was a 2-week open-label lead-in period of risperidone 2-6mg/day, at which time determination of early onset status was determined. Study Period III was a 10-week, double-blind therapy period.

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: Risperiodone Open-Label Lead-In
group.description: All patients completed a 2-week open-label risperidone lead-in period. This group contains all patients who started Study Period II. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Diagnosis
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Non-Global Total Score
measure.description: A 12-item instrument assesses observed abnormal movements in different parts of body. Ten items are scored in a 5-point scale (0 = none/normal, 4 = severe) which evaluates abnormal movements in three main anatomic areas (orofacial area, extremities, and trunk). Two items are yes/no questions regarding dentures. Total scores range from 0 to 42.

measure.title: Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale Total Score
measure.description: Evaluates akathisia associated with use of antipsychotic medications, includes objective and subjective component plus global impression rating for overall disorder. Components rated on scale of 0 to 3 for objective and subjective items and 0 to 5 for global clinical assessment, for total score of 0 (absence of akathisia) to 11 (severe akathisia).

measure.title: Modified Simpson-Angus Scale
measure.description: Measures neuroleptic-induced parkinsonism. Total score consists of the sum of 10 items: 7 items (items 1, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 10) rated on a 4-point severity scale where 0=normal and 4=extreme, and 3 items (items 2, 5, 6) rated on a 2-point severity scale where 0=normal and 2=definitely abnormal/present. The total score ranges from 0 to 34.

measure.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) - Total Score
measure.description: Measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. The MADRS has a 10-item checklist. Items are rated on a scale of 0-6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).

measure.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) - Negative Subscale
measure.description: Assesses negative symptoms associated with schizophrenia. 7 items make up the Negative scale (ex. blunted affect, emotional withdrawal, poor rapport, and passive/apathetic social withdrawal). Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Total Negative Subscale scores range from 7 to 49.

measure.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) - Positive Subscale
measure.description: Assesses positive symptoms associated with schizophrenia. 7 items make up the Positive scale (ex. delusions, conceptual disorganization, and hallucinatory behavior). Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Total Positive Subscale scores range from 7 to 49.

measure.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) - Total Score
measure.description: Assesses the positive symptoms, negative symptoms, and general psychopathology specifically associated with schizophrenia. The scale consists of 30 items. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). The sum of the 30 items is defined as the PANSS total score and ranges from 30 to 210.

outcome.title: Changes From Study Period II Baseline (Week 0) to Weeks 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score in Early Onset Response and Not Early Onset Response-Risperidone Patients
outcome.description: Assesses positive symptoms, negative symptoms, and general psychopathology specifically associated with schizophrenia. Scale consists of 30 items. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Sum of 30 items is PANSS total score and ranges from 30 to 210. Change = time point - single-blind baseline (Week 0).
outcome.population: Intention to treat for patients with both baseline and any postbaseline assessment

group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS

measure.description: Assesses positive symptoms, negative symptoms, and general psychopathology specifically associated with schizophrenia. Scale consists of 30 items. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Sum of 30 items is PANSS total score and ranges from 30 to 210. Change = time point - single-blind baseline (Week 0).
measure.population: Intention to treat for patients with both baseline and any postbaseline assessment

analysis.p_value_desc: Between-group p-values for each baseline to post-baseline visit were the same, p<0.001.

Change = time point - double-blind baseline (Week 2).
outcome.population: Intention to treat patients with both baseline and postbaseline assessment

outcome.title: The Number of Participants in the Early Onset (EO) and Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced a 20% or greater reduction in their PANSS Total score during the 12 weeks they were on risperidone.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: The Number of Participants in the Early Onset (EO) and Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
measure.description: The number of participants who experienced a 20% or greater reduction in their PANSS Total score during the 12 weeks they were on risperidone.
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

outcome.title: The Number of Participants in the Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) and Not Early Onset-Olanzapine (NEO-OLZ) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
outcome.description: The number of not early onset participants who experienced a 20% or greater reduction in PANSS Total Score at any time during the 12 weeks of combined Study Period II and Study Period III.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: The Number of Participants in the Not Early Onset-Risperidone (NEO-RIS) and Not Early Onset-Olanzapine (NEO-OLZ) Groups Who Show a 20% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
measure.description: The number of not early onset participants who experienced a 20% or greater reduction in PANSS Total Score at any time during the 12 weeks of combined Study Period II and Study Period III.
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

outcome.title: Number of Participants in the Early Onset and Not Early Onset-Risperidone Groups Who Show a 50% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score From Baseline or Meet 'a Priori' Specified Criteria for Remission
outcome.description: 'a priori' specified criteria for remission defined as a score of 3 (mild), 2 (minimal), or 1 (absent) on all of the following 8 PANSS items: delusions, conceptual disorganization, hallucinatory behavior, unusual thought content, mannerisms and posturing, blunted effect, passive/apathetic withdrawal, lack of spontaneity and flow of conversation.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: Number of Participants in the Early Onset and Not Early Onset-Risperidone Groups Who Show a 50% or Greater Reduction in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score From Baseline or Meet 'a Priori' Specified Criteria for Remission
measure.description: 'a priori' specified criteria for remission defined as a score of 3 (mild), 2 (minimal), or 1 (absent) on all of the following 8 PANSS items: delusions, conceptual disorganization, hallucinatory behavior, unusual thought content, mannerisms and posturing, blunted effect, passive/apathetic withdrawal, lack of spontaneity and flow of conversation.
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 1 - visit 2) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

outcome.description: 'a priori' specified criteria for remission defined as a score of 3 (mild), 2 (minimal), or 1 (absent) on all of the following 8 PANSS items: delusions, conceptual disorganization, hallucinatory behavior, unusual thought content, mannerisms and posturing, blunted effect, passive/apathetic withdrawal, lack of spontaneity and flow of conversation.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Psychiatric Hospitalizations in the Early Onset and Not Early Onset-Risperidone Groups
outcome.description: Psychiatric Hospitalizations were measured by the Modified Schizophrenia Care and Assessment Program Health Questionnaire (SCAP-HQ) from which it could be determined the number of patients with a psychiatric episode that required an overnight stay in a hospital.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

Required overnight stay in hospital: No

outcome.title: Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Body Mass Index
outcome.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared. Change = Endpoint minus baseline.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: Vital Signs - Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Body Mass Index
measure.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared. Change = Endpoint minus baseline.
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-values (Change from Baseline) are based on Type III sums of squares from ANOVA model: change = group pooled investigator.
P-values (Change from Baseline) are based on Type III sums of squares from ANOVA model: change = group pooled investigator.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Abnormal Fasting Laboratory Analytes Reported in >=2% of All Participants
outcome.description: Number of participants who experienced abnormal fasting laboratory values at any time during Study Period III. Laboratory reference ranges are dependent on the patient's gender, origin, and age.
outcome.population: Total number of patients with the lab test at baseline and post-baseline.

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: NEO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Abnormal Fasting Laboratory Analytes Reported in >=2% of All Participants
measure.description: Number of participants who experienced abnormal fasting laboratory values at any time during Study Period III. Laboratory reference ranges are dependent on the patient's gender, origin, and age.
measure.population: Total number of patients with the lab test at baseline and post-baseline.

analysis.p_value_desc: All comparisons between EO-RIS and NEO-RIS and between NEO-RIS and NEO-OLZ had p-values greater than 0.05.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Modified Simpson-Angus Scale
outcome.description: Measures neuroleptic-induced parkinsonism. Total score consists of the sum of 10 items: 7 items (items 1, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 10) rated on a 4-point severity scale where 0=normal and 4=extreme, and 3 items (items 2, 5, 6) rated on a 2-point severity scale where 0=normal and 2=definitely abnormal/present. The total score ranges from 0 to 34.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

group.title: NEO-OLZ
group.description: Olanzapine for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Olanzapine: 10-20 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.description: Risperidone for not early onset response (NEO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

group.title: EO-RIS
group.description: Risperidone for early onset response (EO) patients. Risperidone: 2-6 mg, oral, daily for 10 weeks

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Modified Simpson-Angus Scale
measure.description: Measures neuroleptic-induced parkinsonism. Total score consists of the sum of 10 items: 7 items (items 1, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 10) rated on a 4-point severity scale where 0=normal and 4=extreme, and 3 items (items 2, 5, 6) rated on a 2-point severity scale where 0=normal and 2=definitely abnormal/present. The total score ranges from 0 to 34.
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

analysis.method_desc: p-value is from ANOVA with treatment and pooled investigator in the model.
p-value is from ANOVA with treatment and pooled investigator in the model.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale - Total Score
outcome.description: Evaluates akathisia associated with use of antipsychotic medications, includes objective and subjective component plus global impression rating for overall disorder. Components rated on scale of 0 to 3 for objective and subjective items and 0 to 5 for global clinical assessment, for total score of 0 (absence of akathisia) to 11 (severe akathisia).
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale - Total Score
measure.description: Evaluates akathisia associated with use of antipsychotic medications, includes objective and subjective component plus global impression rating for overall disorder. Components rated on scale of 0 to 3 for objective and subjective items and 0 to 5 for global clinical assessment, for total score of 0 (absence of akathisia) to 11 (severe akathisia).
measure.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

analysis.method_desc: P-value is from ANOVA with treatment and pooled investigator in the model.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline to 10 Week Endpoint in Extrapyramidal Symptoms as Measured by the Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)- Non-Global Total Score
outcome.description: A 12-item instrument assesses observed abnormal movements in different parts of body. Ten items are scored in a 5-point scale (0 = none/normal, 4 = severe) which evaluates abnormal movements in three main anatomic areas (orofacial area, extremities, and trunk). Two items are yes/no questions regarding dentures. Total scores range from 0 to 42.
outcome.population: Total number of patients having nonmissing values at both baseline (last of visit 3 - visit 4) and post baseline (last of visit 5 - visit 9) visits.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
